nodes.name: createMarket

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address,struct XBRTypes.EIP712MarketCreate memory,bytes memory) pure returns (bool)
function (address) view external returns (uint256,string memory,string memory,enum XBRTypes.MemberLevel,bytes memory)

nodes.name: openPaymentChannel

nodes.documentation:
As a data provider, request a new payment channel to get paid by the market maker. Given sufficient
security amount (deposited by the data provider when joining the marker) to cover the request amount,
the market maker will open a payment (state) channel to allow the market maker buying data keys in
microtransactions, and offchain. The creation of the payment channel is asynchronously: the market maker
is watching the global blockchain filtering for events relevant to the market managed by the maker.
When a request to open a payment channel is recognized by the market maker, it will check the provider
for sufficient security deposit covering the requested amount, and if all is fine, create a new payment
channel and store the contract address for the channel request ID, so the data provider can retrieve it.
     * @param marketId The ID of the market to request a paying channel within.
@param delegate The address of the (offchain) provider delegate allowed to sell into the channel.
@param amount Amount of XBR Token to deposit into the paying channel (the initial off-chain balance).
@param timeout Channel timeout which will apply.
nodes.name: requestPayingChannel

nodes.name: openPaymentChannel

nodes.documentation:
As a data provider, request a new payment channel to get paid by the market maker. Given sufficient
security amount (deposited by the data provider when joining the marker) to cover the request amount,
the market maker will open a payment (state) channel to allow the market maker buying data keys in
microtransactions, and offchain. The creation of the payment channel is asynchronously: the market maker
is watching the global blockchain filtering for events relevant to the market managed by the maker.
When a request to open a payment channel is recognized by the market maker, it will check the provider
for sufficient security deposit covering the requested amount, and if all is fine, create a new payment
channel and store the contract address for the channel request ID, so the data provider can retrieve it.
     * @param marketId The ID of the market to request a paying channel within.
@param delegate The address of the (offchain) provider delegate allowed to sell into the channel.
@param amount Amount of XBR Token to deposit into the paying channel (the initial off-chain balance).
@param timeout Channel timeout which will apply.
nodes.name: requestPayingChannel

currentPayingChannelByDelegate

params.account: The account to grant maintainer rights to.

params.network_: The network this market is part of.

params.consumerSecurity: The amount of XBR tokens a XBR consumer joining the market must deposit.
params.maker: The address of the XBR market maker that will run this market. The delegate of the market owner.
params.marketFee: The fee taken by the market (beneficiary is the market owner). The fee is a percentage of                 the revenue of the XBR Provider that receives XBR Token paid for transactions.                 The fee must be between 0% (inclusive) and 99% (inclusive), and is expressed as                 a fraction of the total supply of XBR tokens.
params.marketId: The ID of the market to create. Must be unique (not yet existing). To generate a new ID you can do `python -c "import uuid; print(uuid.uuid4().bytes.hex())"`.
params.meta: The XBR market metadata published by the market owner. IPFS Multihash pointing            to a RDF/Turtle file with market metadata.
params.providerSecurity: The amount of XBR tokens a XBR provider joining the market must deposit.
params.terms: The XBR market terms set by the market owner. IPFS Multihash pointing             to a ZIP archive file with market documents.

params.delegate: The delegate to get the current paying channel address for.
params.marketId: The XBR Market to get the current paying channel address for.

currentPayingChannelByDelegate(bytes16,a.return: Current paying channel address for the given delegate/market.

params.delegate: The delegate to get the current payment channel address for.
params.marketId: The XBR Market to get the current payment channel address for.

params.marketId: The XBR Market to consumer actors for.

params.marketId: The XBR Market to provider actors for.

params.actor: The XBR actor to get paying channels for.
params.marketId: The XBR Market to get paying channels for.

params.actor: The XBR actor to get payment channels for.
params.marketId: The XBR Market to get payment channels for.

getAllPaymentChannels(bytes16,address).return: List of contract addresses of payment channels in the market.

isMaintainer(address).return: `true` if the account is maintainer, otherwise `false`.

params.actorType: The type of actor under which to join: PROVIDER or CONSUMER.
params.marketId: The ID of the XBR data market to join.
params.meta: The XBR market provider/consumer metadata. IPFS Multihash pointing to a JSON file with metadata.

params.amount: Amount of XBR Token to deposit into the paying channel (the initial off-chain balance).
params.delegate: The address of the (offchain) provider delegate allowed to earn on the channel.
params.marketId: The ID of the market to open a paying channel within.
params.recipient: Ultimate recipient of tokens earned, recipient must be provider in the market.

params.amount: Amount of XBR Token to deposit into the payment channel (the initial off-chain balance).
params.delegate: The address of the (offchain) consumer delegate allowed to consume the channel.
params.marketId: The ID of the market to open a payment channel within.
params.recipient: Recipient of the earned off-chain transaction amounts of this single channel,                 commonly the market operator.

params.amount: Amount of XBR Token to deposit into the paying channel (the initial off-chain balance).
params.delegate: The address of the (offchain) provider delegate allowed to sell into the channel.
params.marketId: The ID of the market to request a paying channel within.

addMaintainer(address).notice: Add a new maintainer to the list of maintainers.

createMarket(bytes16,string,string,addre.notice: Create a new XBR market. The sender of the transaction must be XBR network member and automatically becomes owner of the new market.

currentPayingChannelByDelegate(bytes16,a.notice: Lookup the current paying channel to use for the given delegate in the given market.

currentPaymentChannelByDelegate(bytes16,.notice: Lookup the current payment channel to use for the given delegate in the given market.

getAllMarketConsumers(bytes16).notice: Lookup all consumer actors in a XBR Market.

getAllMarketProviders(bytes16).notice: Lookup all provider actors in a XBR Market.

getAllPayingChannels(bytes16,address).notice: Lookup all paying channels for an provider actor in a XBR Market.

getAllPaymentChannels(bytes16,address).notice: Lookup all payment channels for an consumer actor in a XBR Market.

isMaintainer(address).notice: Check if the given address is currently a maintainer.

joinMarket(bytes16,uint8,string).notice: Join the given XBR market as the specified type of actor, which must be PROVIDER or CONSUMER.

openPayingChannel(bytes16,address,addres.notice: Open a new paying channel and deposit an amount of XBR token for off-chain consumption. Must be called by the market maker in response to a successful request for a paying channel.

openPaymentChannel(bytes16,address,addre.notice: Open a new payment channel and deposit an amount of XBR token for off-chain consumption. Must be called by the data consumer (XBR buyer) and an off-chain buyer delegate address must be given.

requestPayingChannel(bytes16,address,add.notice: As a data provider, request a new payment channel to get paid by the market maker. Given sufficient security amount (deposited by the data provider when joining the marker) to cover the request amount, the market maker will open a payment (state) channel to allow the market maker buying data keys in microtransactions, and offchain. The creation of the payment channel is asynchronously: the market maker is watching the global blockchain filtering for events relevant to the market managed by the maker. When a request to open a payment channel is recognized by the market maker, it will check the provider for sufficient security deposit covering the requested amount, and if all is fine, create a new payment channel and store the contract address for the channel request ID, so the data provider can retrieve it.
